isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - LETTERING/DECALS - SURFACE PREPARATION

svcprocinfo.para: All surfaces must be considered dirty and must be cleaned prior to the application of markings. Recommended cleaning procedures for specific surfaces are listed below.

svcsubproc.title: Plastic and Glass
svcsubproc.para: Saturate a clean cloth with a two to one mixture of water and isopropyl alcohol and wipe the surface (cleaners such as Windex® may be used). Wipe the surface dry with a clean, dry, lint-free cloth.

svcsubproc.title: Painted Metals and Base Metals
svcsubproc.para: These surfaces must be cleaned with a solvent such as E.I. DuPont PreSol Cleaning Solvent 39195, Xylol, VM & P Naptha, or Lacquer Thinner. Dry the surface with a lint-free cloth before the solvent evaporates. Freshly painted surfaces must be dried one week prior to application of a cleaning solvent.

svcsubproc.title: Interior Painted Surfaces
svcsubproc.para: Paint must be dried one week prior to application of markings. Clean the area where the markings are to be applied with a household cleaner such as 409®. Rinse thoroughly and dry.

svcsubproc.title: Temperature Requirements
svcsubproc.para: Air and application surface temperature must be above 40°F for decals to function properly.

step1.para: Use 1" - 2" strips of masking tape to position marking in proper register ( Figure 55).
Squeegee masking in place with squeegee pressure ( Figure 56).
Remove liner entirely and allow marking to drape. Using firm initial squeegee pressure, begin at top center and work down and out to each edge of mask ( Figure 57).
